title: RIP-26 Collaboration with Gautham Elango (Solidity/React Dev)
body:
**Summary**
I, Gautham, propose to work for the Rari Capital DAO on a part time basis to continue development of a product for the Fuse ecosystem. [This product is a margin trading tool for Fuse that allows for opening leveraged long/short positions in 1 click](https://github.com/Rari-Capital/fuse-margin). It solves [this problem](https://twitter.com/Tetranode/status/1381353501784043521), allowing for positions to be opened at a desired leverage instantly. I finished developing and testing the contracts and I've started work on a frontend. 350 RGT will be provided as compensation.

**Background**
I'm a 19 year old CS student from Australia and I'm currently a full time Solidity/React developer at a defi protocol that is yet to launch. In the past I've worked on different Solidity projects for the Aave ecosystem, building a similar tool. What got me interested in Fuse was the possibilities you could have with a permissionless protocol for creating isolated lending markets, which made me want to build an idea of mine on top of it.

- [GitHub](https://github.com/gg2001)
- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/GauthamGE)

**Abstract**
I've finished developing the margin trading contracts, and I've written tests covering all the functions: [Rari-Capital/fuse-margin](https://github.com/Rari-Capital/fuse-margin). I tested the opening and closing of positions, and both work perfectly. The contracts are ready to deploy anytime, however I have not deployed them as of yet due to todays spike in gas prices. When the "Fast" option on GasNow drops down to a reasonable price such as 120 Gwei, I will be deploying the contracts to mainnet.

I started work on this project on March 14th, and the first 2-3 weeks were mainly focused on understanding how to interact with Fuse, testing different DEX aggregators to integrate and also comparing flash loan lenders to see which would suit this project the most. After that, I developed the contracts, deciding to integrate 0x/1Inch as the DEX aggregators and Uniswap for flash loans.

Today I started work on a frontend to interact with the margin trading contracts and I will be launching it in under 3 days from now.

I propose to work for the DAO on a part time basis to continue the development of this project. I will be focused on adding additional features to the contracts and improvements to the UI. Here are 4 main features I will be implementing:

- Add optional DYDX flash loan support (to reduce the flash loan borrow fee in exchange for more gas usage)
- Add ETH support, currently the contracts are designed only for ERC20s
- Allow for adding collateral to a position or to repay positions early to prevent liquidation
- Use flash swaps rather than flash loans. This would reduce gas usage

Over the next 2-3 weeks I will be adding these features and making improvements to the frontend. In the long term I'd like to see this project be integrated natively into rari.capital and ownership of the Controller contract be transferred to the Rari DAO. However, at least for the next 3 weeks I will be retaining ownership over the contracts so I can iterate on adding new features more quickly. After the transfer of ownership to the DAO, I intend to continue contributing to this project and possibly work on new ideas similar to this for the Fuse ecosystem

This work will be done for a payment of 350 RGT, subject to DAO approval. Here is a breakdown of what the payment will be for:

- 50 RGT will be a refund for the contract deployment costs. At 100 gwei it will cost 0.73 ETH to deploy the contracts
- 300 RGT will be to compensate the existing work done on the contracts and also future work on the frontend
- Compensation for upgrades to the contracts will be done in a separate proposal in the future once the upgrades have been made

**Motivation**

Just like how Uniswap made it possible to trade long tail assets, Fuse makes it possible to lend and borrow against long tail assets. It is important that Fuse has an ecosystem of products built on top of it since it enables new ways of using Fuse outside of purely lending and borrowing. This margin trading tool will be the first product for the Fuse ecosystem.
